Name: attrelid
Description: the table this column belongs to

Name: atttypid
Description: the data type of this column

Name: attstattarget
Description: attstattarget controls the level of detail of statistics accumulated for this column by analyze. a zero value indicates that no statistics should be collected. a negative value says to use the system default statistics target. the exact meaning of positive values is data type-dependent. for scalar data types, attstattarget is both the target number of "most common values" to collect, and the target number of histogram bins to create

Name: attlen
Description: a copy of pg_type.typlen of this column's type

Name: attnum
Description: the number of the column. ordinary columns are numbered from 1 up. system columns, such as oid, have (arbitrary) negative numbers

Name: attndims
Description: number of dimensions, if the column is an array type; otherwise 0. (presently, the number of dimensions of an array is not enforced, so any nonzero value effectively means "it's an array")

Name: attcacheoff
Description: always -1 in storage, but when loaded into a row descriptor in memory this might be updated to cache the offset of the attribute within the row

Name: atttypmod
Description: atttypmod records type-specific data supplied at table creation time (for example, the maximum length of a varchar column). it is passed to type-specific input functions and length coercion functions. the value will generally be -1 for types that do not need atttypmod

Name: attbyval
Description: a copy of pg_type.typbyval of this column's type

Name: attstorage
Description: normally a copy of pg_type.typstorage of this column's type. for toast-able data types, this can be altered after column creation to control storage policy

Name: attalign
Description: a copy of pg_type.typalign of this column's type

Name: attnotnull
Description: this represents a not-null constraint. it is possible to change this column to enable or disable the constraint

Name: atthasdef
Description: this column has a default value, in which case there will be a corresponding entry in the pg_attrdef catalog that actually defines the value

Name: attisdropped
Description: this column has been dropped and is no longer valid. a dropped column is still physically present in the table, but is ignored by the parser and so cannot be accessed via sql

Name: attislocal
Description: this column is defined locally in the relation. note that a column can be locally defined and inherited simultaneously

Name: attinhcount
Description: the number of direct ancestors this column has. a column with a nonzero number of ancestors cannot be dropped nor renamed
